rows.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
rows.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
rows.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

rows.arabic: الٓمٓ
rows.translation: Alif. Lam. Mim.
rows.transliteration: alif lām mīm

rows.arabic: أَحَسِبَ ٱلنَّاسُ أَن يُتْرَكُوٓا۟ أَن يَقُولُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا وَهُمْ لَا يُفْتَنُونَ
rows.translation: Do men imagine that they will be left (at ease) because they say, We believe, and will not be tested with affliction?
rows.transliteration: aḥasiban nāsu an yutrakū an yaqūlū āmannā wahum lā yuftanūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۖ فَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ صَدَقُوا۟ وَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
rows.translation: Lo! We tested those who were before you. Thus Allah knoweth those who are sincere, and knoweth those who feign.
rows.transliteration: walaqad fatannal ladhīna min qablihim ۖ falaya`lamannallāhul ladhīna ṣadaqū walaya`lamannal kādhibīn

rows.arabic: أَمْ حَسِبَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ أَن يَسْبِقُونَا ۚ سَآءَ مَا يَحْكُمُونَ
rows.translation: Or do those who do ill-deeds imagine that they can outstrip Us? Evil (for them) is that which they decide.
rows.transliteration: am ḥasibal ladhīna ya`malūnas sayyi-āti an yasbiqūnā ۚ sā-a mā yaḥkumūn

rows.arabic: مَن كَانَ يَرْجُوا۟ لِقَآءَ ٱللَّهِ فَإِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ لَـَٔاتٍ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
rows.translation: Whoso looketh forward to the meeting with Allah (let him know that) Allah's reckoning is surely nigh, and He is the Hearer, the Knower.
rows.transliteration: man kāna yarjū liqā-allāhi fa-inna ajalallāhi la-āt ۚ wahuwas samī`ul `alīm

rows.arabic: وَمَن جَـٰهَدَ فَإِنَّمَا يُجَـٰهِدُ لِنَفْسِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَغَنِىٌّ عَنِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: And whosoever striveth, striveth only for himself, for lo! Allah is altogether Independent of (His) creatures.
rows.transliteration: wa man jāhada fa-innamā yujāhidu linafsih ۚ innallāha laghaniyyun `anil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَنُكَفِّرَنَّ عَنْهُمْ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمْ وَلَنَجْزِيَنَّهُمْ أَحْسَنَ ٱلَّذِى كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: And as for those who believe and do good works, We shall remit from them their evil deeds and shall repay them the best that they did.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti lanukaffiranna `anhum sayyi-ātihim walanajziyannahum aḥsanal ladhī kānū ya`malūn

rows.arabic: وَوَصَّيْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ بِوَٰلِدَيْهِ حُسْنًا ۖ وَإِن جَـٰهَدَاكَ لِتُشْرِكَ بِى مَا لَيْسَ لَكَ بِهِۦ عِلْمٌ فَلَا تُطِعْهُمَآ ۚ إِلَىَّ مَرْجِعُكُمْ فَأُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: We have enjoined on man kindness to parents; but if they strive to make thee join with Me that of which thou hast no knowledge, then obey them not. Unto Me is your return and I shall tell you what ye used to do.
rows.transliteration: wawaṣṣaynal-insāna biwālidayhi ḥusnā ۖ wa in jāhadāka litushrika bī mā laysa laka bihi `il-mun falā tuṭi`humā ۚ ilayya marji`ukum fa-unabbi-ukum bimā kuntum ta`malūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَنُدْخِلَنَّهُمْ فِى ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
rows.translation: And as for those who believe and do good works, We verily shall make them enter in among the righteous.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti lanudkhilannahum fiṣ ṣāliḥīn

rows.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يَقُولُ ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ فَإِذَآ أُوذِىَ فِى ٱللَّهِ جَعَلَ فِتْنَةَ ٱلنَّاسِ كَعَذَابِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَئِن جَآءَ نَصْرٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ لَيَقُولُنَّ إِنَّا كُنَّا مَعَكُمْ ۚ أَوَلَيْسَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَعْلَمَ بِمَا فِى صُدُورِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: Of mankind is he who saith: We believe in Allah, but, if he be made to suffer for the sake of Allah, he mistaketh the persecution of mankind for Allah's punishment; and then, if victory cometh from thy Lord, will say: Lo! we were with you (all the while). Is not Allah Best Aware of what is in the bosoms of (His) creatures?
rows.transliteration: wa minan nāsi man yaqūlu āmannā billāhi fa-idhā ūdhiya fillāhi ja`ala fitnatan nāsi ka`adhābillāhi wala-in jā-a naṣrun min rabbika layaqūlunna innā kunnā ma`akum ۚ awalaysallāhu bi-a`lama bimā fī ṣudūril `ālamīn

rows.arabic: وَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ
rows.translation: Verily Allah knoweth those who believe, and verily He knoweth the hypocrites.
rows.transliteration: walaya`lamannallāhul ladhīna āmanū walaya`lamannal munāfiqīn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّبِعُوا۟ سَبِيلَنَا وَلْنَحْمِلْ خَطَـٰيَـٰكُمْ وَمَا هُم بِحَـٰمِلِينَ مِنْ خَطَـٰيَـٰهُم مِّن شَىْءٍ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ لَكَـٰذِبُونَ
rows.translation: Those who disbelieve say unto those who believe: Follow our way (of religion) and we verily will bear your sins (for you). They cannot bear aught of their sins. Lo! they verily are liars.
rows.transliteration: waqālal ladhīna kafarū lilladhīna āmanut-tabi`ū sabīlanā walnaḥmil khaṭāyākum wa mā hum biḥāmilīna min khaṭāyāhum min shay-ī ۖ innahum lakādhibūn

rows.arabic: وَلَيَحْمِلُنَّ أَثْقَالَهُمْ وَأَثْقَالًا مَّعَ أَثْقَالِهِمْ ۖ وَلَيُسْـَٔلُنَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ عَمَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
rows.translation: But they verily will bear their own loads and other loads beside their own, and they verily will be questioned on the Day of Resurrection concerning that which they invented.
rows.transliteration: walayaḥmilunna athqālahum wa-athqālan ma`a athqālihim ۖ walayus-alunna yawmal qiyāmati `ammā kānū yaftarūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ فَلَبِثَ فِيهِمْ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ إِلَّا خَمْسِينَ عَامًا فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلطُّوفَانُ وَهُمْ ظَـٰلِمُونَ
rows.translation: And verily we sent Noah (as Our messenger) unto his folk, and he continued with them for a thousand years save fifty years; and the flood engulfed them, for they were wrong-doers.
rows.transliteration: walaqad arsalnā nūḥan ilā qawmihi falabitha fīhim alfa sanatin illā khamsīna `āman fa-akhadhahumuṭ ṭūfānu wahum ẓālimūn

rows.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَأَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلسَّفِينَةِ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهَآ ءَايَةً لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: And We rescued him and those with him in the ship, and made of it a portent for the peoples.
rows.transliteration: fa-anjaynāhu wa-aṣ-ḥābas safīnati waja`alnāhā āyatan lil`ālamīn

rows.arabic: وَإِبْرَٰهِيمَ إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ ۖ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: And Abraham! (Remember) when he said unto his folk: Serve Allah, and keep your duty unto Him; that is better for you if ye did but know.
rows.transliteration: wa ibrāhīma idh qāla liqawmihi'-budullāha wattaqūh ۖ dhālikum khayrul lakum in kuntum ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَوْثَـٰنًا وَتَخْلُقُونَ إِفْكًا ۚ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ لَكُمْ رِزْقًا فَٱبْتَغُوا۟ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرِّزْقَ وَٱعْبُدُوهُ وَٱشْكُرُوا۟ لَهُۥٓ ۖ إِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
rows.translation: Ye serve instead of Allah only idols, and ye only invent a lie. Lo! those whom ye serve instead of Allah own no provision for you. So seek your provision from Allah, and serve Him, and give thanks unto Him, (for) unto Him ye will be brought back.
rows.transliteration: innamā ta`budūna min dūnillāhi awthānan watakhluqūna ifkā ۚ innal ladhīna ta`budūna min dūnillāhi lā yamlikūna lakum rizqan fabtaghū `indallāhir rizqa wa`budūhu washkurū lah ۖ ilayhi turja`ūn

rows.arabic: وَإِن تُكَذِّبُوا۟ فَقَدْ كَذَّبَ أُمَمٌ مِّن قَبْلِكُمْ ۖ وَمَا عَلَى ٱلرَّسُولِ إِلَّا ٱلْبَلَـٰغُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
rows.translation: But if ye deny, then nations have denied before you. The messenger is only to convey (the message) plainly.
rows.transliteration: wa in tukadhhibū faqad kadhhaba umamun min qablikum ۖ wa mā `alar rasūli illal-balāghul mubīn

rows.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ كَيْفَ يُبْدِئُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرٌ
rows.translation: See they not how Allah produceth creation, then reproduceth it? Lo! for Allah that is easy.
rows.transliteration: awalam yaraw kayfa yubdi-ullāhul khalqa thumma yu`īduh ۚ inna dhālika `alallāhi yasīr

rows.arabic: قُلْ سِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ بَدَأَ ٱلْخَلْقَ ۚ ثُمَّ ٱللَّهُ يُنشِئُ ٱلنَّشْأَةَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
rows.translation: Say (O Muhammad): Travel in the land and see how He originated creation, then Allah bringeth forth the later growth. Lo! Allah is Able to do all things.
rows.transliteration: qul sīrū fil-arḍi fanẓurū kayfa bada-al khalq ۚ thummallāhu yunshi-un nash-atal-ākhirah ۚ innallāha `alā kulli shay-in qadīr

rows.arabic: يُعَذِّبُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَرْحَمُ مَن يَشَآءُ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ تُقْلَبُونَ
rows.translation: He punisheth whom He will and showeth mercy unto whom He will, and unto Him ye will be turned.
rows.transliteration: yu`adhhibu man yashā-u wayarḥamu man yashā-u ۖ wa ilayhi tuqlabūn

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَنتُم بِمُعْجِزِينَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ ۖ وَمَا لَكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَلِىٍّ وَلَا نَصِيرٍ
rows.translation: Ye cannot escape (from Him) in the earth or in the sky, and beside Allah there is for you no friend or helper.
rows.transliteration: wa mā antum bimu`jizīna fil-arḍi walā fis samā-i ۖ wa mā lakum min dūnillāhi min waliyyin walā naṣīr

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَلِقَآئِهِۦٓ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَئِسُوا۟ مِن رَّحْمَتِى وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: Those who disbelieve in the revelations of Allah and in (their) Meeting with Him, such have no hope of My mercy. For such there is a painful doom.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna kafarū bi-āyātillāhi waliqā-ihi ulā-ika ya-isū min raḥmatī wa-ulā-ika lahum `adhābun alīm

rows.arabic: فَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوا۟ ٱقْتُلُوهُ أَوْ حَرِّقُوهُ فَأَنجَىٰهُ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلنَّارِ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: But the answer of his folk was only that they said: "Kill him" or "Burn him." Then Allah saved him from the Fire. Lo! herein verily are portents for folk who believe.
rows.transliteration: famā kāna jawāba qawmihi illā an qāluq-tulūhu aw ḥarriqūhu fa-anjāhullāhu minan nār ۚ inna fī dhālika la-āyātin liqawmiy yu-minūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ إِنَّمَا ٱتَّخَذْتُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَوْثَـٰنًا مَّوَدَّةَ بَيْنِكُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ ثُمَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ يَكْفُرُ بَعْضُكُم بِبَعْضٍ وَيَلْعَنُ بَعْضُكُم بَعْضًا وَمَأْوَىٰكُمُ ٱلنَّارُ وَمَا لَكُم مِّن نَّـٰصِرِينَ
rows.translation: He said: Ye have chosen only idols instead of Allah. The love between you is only in the life of the world. Then on the Day of Resurrection ye will deny each other and curse each other, and your abode will be the Fire, and ye will have no helpers.
rows.transliteration: waqāla innamat-takhadhtum min dūnillāhi awthānan mawaddata baynikum fil ḥayātid dunyā ۖ thumma yawmal qiyāmati yakfuru ba`ḍukum biba`ḍin wayal`anu ba`ḍukum ba`ḍan wa ma-wākumun nāru wa mā lakum min nāṣirīn

rows.arabic: فَـَٔامَنَ لَهُۥ لُوطٌ ۘ وَقَالَ إِنِّى مُهَاجِرٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّىٓ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
rows.translation: And Lot believed him, and said: Lo! I am a fugitive unto my Lord. Lo! He, only He, is the Mighty, the Wise.
rows.transliteration: fa-āmana lahu lūṭ ۘ waqāla innī muhājirun ilā rabbī ۖ innahu huwal `azīzul ḥakīm

rows.arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ وَجَعَلْنَا فِى ذُرِّيَّتِهِ ٱلنُّبُوَّةَ وَٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ أَجْرَهُۥ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَإِنَّهُۥ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ لَمِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
rows.translation: And We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and We established the prophethood and the Scripture among his seed, and We gave him his reward in the world, and lo! in the Hereafter he verily is among the righteous.
rows.transliteration: wawahabnā lahu is-ḥāqa waya`qūba waja`alnā fī dhurriyyatihin nubuwwata wal kitāba wa-ātaynāhu ajrahu fid dunyā ۖ wa innahu fil-ākhirati laminaṣ ṣāliḥīn

rows.arabic: وَلُوطًا إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ ٱلْفَـٰحِشَةَ مَا سَبَقَكُم بِهَا مِنْ أَحَدٍ مِّنَ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: And Lot! (Remember) when he said unto his folk: Lo! ye commit lewdness such as no creature did before you.
rows.transliteration: walūṭan idh qāla liqawmihi innakum lata-tūnal fāḥishata mā sabaqakum bihā min aḥadin minal `ālamīn

rows.arabic: أَئِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ ٱلرِّجَالَ وَتَقْطَعُونَ ٱلسَّبِيلَ وَتَأْتُونَ فِى نَادِيكُمُ ٱلْمُنكَرَ ۖ فَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوا۟ ٱئْتِنَا بِعَذَابِ ٱللَّهِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: For come ye not in unto males, and cut ye not the road (for travellers), and commit ye not abomination in your meetings? But the answer of his folk was only that they said: Bring Allah's doom upon us if thou art a truthteller!
rows.transliteration: a-innakum lata-tūnar rijāla wataqṭa`ūnas sabīla wata-tūna fī nādīkumul munkar ۖ famā kāna jawāba qawmihi illā an qālu-tinā bi`adhābillāhi in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱنصُرْنِى عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
rows.translation: He said: My Lord! Give me victory over folk who work corruption.
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbin-ṣurnī `alal-qawmil mufsidīn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَآءَتْ رُسُلُنَآ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ بِٱلْبُشْرَىٰ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا مُهْلِكُوٓا۟ أَهْلِ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْقَرْيَةِ ۖ إِنَّ أَهْلَهَا كَانُوا۟ ظَـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: And when Our messengers brought Abraham the good news, they said: Lo! we are about to destroy the people of that township, for its people are wrong-doers.
rows.transliteration: walammā jā-at rusulunā ibrāhīma bil bushrā qālū innā muhlikū ahli hādhihil qaryah ۖ inna ahlahā kānū ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ فِيهَا لُوطًا ۚ قَالُوا۟ نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن فِيهَا ۖ لَنُنَجِّيَنَّهُۥ وَأَهْلَهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَهُۥ كَانَتْ مِنَ ٱلْغَـٰبِرِينَ
rows.translation: He said: Lo! Lot is there. They said: We are best aware of who is there. We are to deliver him and his household, all save his wife, who is of those who stay behind.
rows.transliteration: qāla inna fīhā lūṭā ۚ qālū naḥnu a`lamu biman fīhā ۖ lanunajjiyannahu wa-ahlahu illam-ra-atahu kānat minal ghābirīn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّآ أَن جَآءَتْ رُسُلُنَا لُوطًا سِىٓءَ بِهِمْ وَضَاقَ بِهِمْ ذَرْعًا وَقَالُوا۟ لَا تَخَفْ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ ۖ إِنَّا مُنَجُّوكَ وَأَهْلَكَ إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَكَ كَانَتْ مِنَ ٱلْغَـٰبِرِينَ
rows.translation: And when Our messengers came unto Lot, he was troubled upon their account, for he could not protect them; but they said: Fear not, nor grieve! Lo! we are to deliver thee and thy household, (all) save thy wife, who is of those who stay behind.
rows.transliteration: walammā an jā-at rusulunā lūṭan sī-a bihim waḍāqa bihim dhar`an waqālū lā takhaf walā taḥzan ۖ innā munajjūka wa-ahlaka illam-ra-ataka kānat minal ghābirīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّا مُنزِلُونَ عَلَىٰٓ أَهْلِ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْقَرْيَةِ رِجْزًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْسُقُونَ
rows.translation: Lo! We are about to bring down upon the folk of this township a fury from the sky because they are evil-livers.
rows.transliteration: innā munzilūna `alā ahli hādhihil qaryati rijzan minas samā-i bimā kānū yafsuqūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَد تَّرَكْنَا مِنْهَآ ءَايَةًۢ بَيِّنَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: And verily of that We have left a clear sign for people who have sense.
rows.transliteration: walaqad taraknā minhā āyatan bayyinatan liqawmiy ya`qilūn

rows.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ مَدْيَنَ أَخَاهُمْ شُعَيْبًا فَقَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱرْجُوا۟ ٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
rows.translation: And unto Midian We sent Shu'eyb, their brother. He said: O my people! Serve Allah, and look forward to the Last Day, and do not evil, making mischief, in the earth.
rows.transliteration: wa ilā madyana akhāhum shu`ayban faqāla yāqawmi'-budullāha warjul yawmal-ākhira walā ta`thaw fil-arḍi mufsidīn

rows.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلرَّجْفَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ فِى دَارِهِمْ جَـٰثِمِينَ
rows.translation: But they denied him, and the dreadful earthquake took them, and morning found them prostrate in their dwelling place.
rows.transliteration: fakadhhabūhu fa-akhadhat-humur rajfatu fa-aṣbaḥū fī dārihim jāthimīn

rows.arabic: وَعَادًا وَثَمُودَا۟ وَقَد تَّبَيَّنَ لَكُم مِّن مَّسَـٰكِنِهِمْ ۖ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ وَكَانُوا۟ مُسْتَبْصِرِينَ
rows.translation: And (the tribes of) A'ad and Thamud! (Their fate) is manifest unto you from their (ruined and deserted) dwellings. Satan made their deeds seem fair unto them and so debarred them from the Way, though they were keen observers.
rows.transliteration: wa`ādan wathamūda waqad tabayyana lakum min masākinihim ۖ wazayyana lahumush shayṭānu a`mālahum faṣaddahum `anis sabīli wakānū mustabṣirīn

rows.arabic: وَقَـٰرُونَ وَفِرْعَوْنَ وَهَـٰمَـٰنَ ۖ وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُم مُّوسَىٰ بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ فَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ سَـٰبِقِينَ
rows.translation: And Korah, Pharaoh and Haman! Moses came unto them with clear proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty), but they were boastful in the land. And they were not winners (in the race).
rows.transliteration: waqārūna wafir`awna wahāmān ۖ walaqad jā-ahum mūsā bil bayyināti fastakbarū fil-arḍi wa mā kānū sābiqīn

rows.arabic: فَكُلًّا أَخَذْنَا بِذَنۢبِهِۦ ۖ فَمِنْهُم مَّنْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِ حَاصِبًا وَمِنْهُم مَّنْ أَخَذَتْهُ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ وَمِنْهُم مَّنْ خَسَفْنَا بِهِ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَمِنْهُم مَّنْ أَغْرَقْنَا ۚ وَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ لِيَظْلِمَهُمْ وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: So We took each one in his sin; of them was he on whom We sent a hurricane, and of them was he who was overtaken by the (Awful) Cry, and of them was he whom We caused the earth to swallow, and of them was he whom We drowned. It was not for Allah to wrong them, but they wronged themselves.
rows.transliteration: fakullan akhadhnā bidhanbih ۖ faminhum man arsalnā `alayhi ḥāṣiban wa minhum man akhadhat-huṣ ṣayḥatu wa minhum man khasafnā bihil-arḍa wa minhum man aghraqnā ۚ wa mā kānallāhu liyaẓlimahum walākin kānū anfusahum yaẓlimūn

rows.arabic: مَثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَوْلِيَآءَ كَمَثَلِ ٱلْعَنكَبُوتِ ٱتَّخَذَتْ بَيْتًا ۖ وَإِنَّ أَوْهَنَ ٱلْبُيُوتِ لَبَيْتُ ٱلْعَنكَبُوتِ ۖ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: The likeness of those who choose other patrons than Allah is as the likeness of the spider when she taketh unto herself a house, and lo! the frailest of all houses is the spider's house, if they but knew.
rows.transliteration: mathalul ladhīnat-takhadhū min dūnillāhi awliyā-a kamathalil `ankabūtit-takhadhat baytā ۖ wa inna awhanal buyūti labaytul `ankabūt ۖ law kānū ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مِن شَىْءٍ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
rows.translation: Lo! Allah knoweth what thing they invoke instead of Him. He is the Mighty, the Wise.
rows.transliteration: innallāha ya`lamu mā yad`ūna min dūnihi min shay-ī ۚ wahuwal `azīzul ḥakīm

rows.arabic: وَتِلْكَ ٱلْأَمْثَـٰلُ نَضْرِبُهَا لِلنَّاسِ ۖ وَمَا يَعْقِلُهَآ إِلَّا ٱلْعَـٰلِمُونَ
rows.translation: As for these similitudes, We coin them for mankind, but none will grasp their meaning save the wise.
rows.transliteration: watilkal-amthālu naḍribuhā linnās ۖ wa mā ya`qiluhā illal-`ālimūn

rows.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Allah created the heavens and the earth with truth. Lo! therein is indeed a portent for believers.
rows.transliteration: khalaqallāhus samāwāti wal-arḍa bil ḥaqq ۚ inna fī dhālika la-āyatan lil-mu-minīn

rows.arabic: ٱتْلُ مَآ أُوحِىَ إِلَيْكَ مِنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَأَقِمِ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ ۖ إِنَّ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ تَنْهَىٰ عَنِ ٱلْفَحْشَآءِ وَٱلْمُنكَرِ ۗ وَلَذِكْرُ ٱللَّهِ أَكْبَرُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تَصْنَعُونَ
rows.translation: Recite that which hath been inspired in thee of the Scripture, and establish worship. Lo! worship preserveth from lewdness and iniquity, but verily remembrance of Allah is more important. And Allah knoweth what ye do.
rows.transliteration: ut-lu mā ūḥiya ilayka minal kitābi wa-aqimiṣ ṣalāh ۖ innaṣ ṣalāta tanhā `anil faḥshā-i wal munkar ۗ waladhikrullāhi akbar ۗ wallāhu ya`lamu mā taṣna`ūn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تُجَـٰدِلُوٓا۟ أَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ إِلَّا بِٱلَّتِى هِىَ أَحْسَنُ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَقُولُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِٱلَّذِىٓ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْنَا وَأُنزِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ وَإِلَـٰهُنَا وَإِلَـٰهُكُمْ وَٰحِدٌ وَنَحْنُ لَهُۥ مُسْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: And argue not with the People of the Scripture unless it be in (a way) that is better, save with such of them as do wrong; and say: We believe in that which hath been revealed unto us and revealed unto you; our Allah and your Allah is One, and unto Him we surrender.
rows.transliteration: walā tujādilū ahlal-kitābi illā bil latī hiya aḥsanu illal ladhīna ẓalamū minhum ۖ waqūlū āmannā bil ladhī unzila ilaynā wa-unzila ilaykum wa ilāhunā wa ilāhukum wāḥidun wanaḥnu lahu muslimūn

rows.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنزَلْنَآ إِلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ ۚ فَٱلَّذِينَ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ ۖ وَمِنْ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ مَن يُؤْمِنُ بِهِۦ ۚ وَمَا يَجْحَدُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ إِلَّا ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
rows.translation: In like manner We have revealed unto thee the Scripture, and those unto whom We gave the Scripture aforetime will believe therein; and of these (also) there are some who believe therein. And none deny Our revelations save the disbelievers.
rows.transliteration: wakadhālika anzalnā ilaykal kitāb ۚ fal ladhīna ātaynāhumul kitāba yu-minūna bih ۖ wa min hā-ulā-i man yu-minu bih ۚ wa mā yajḥadu bi-āyātinā illal-kāfirūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا كُنتَ تَتْلُوا۟ مِن قَبْلِهِۦ مِن كِتَـٰبٍ وَلَا تَخُطُّهُۥ بِيَمِينِكَ ۖ إِذًا لَّٱرْتَابَ ٱلْمُبْطِلُونَ
rows.translation: And thou (O Muhammad) wast not a reader of any scripture before it, nor didst thou write it with thy right hand, for then might those have doubted, who follow falsehood.
rows.transliteration: wa mā kunta tatlū min qablihi min kitābin walā takhuṭṭuhu biyamīnik ۖ idhal lartābal mubṭilūn

rows.arabic: بَلْ هُوَ ءَايَـٰتٌۢ بَيِّنَـٰتٌ فِى صُدُورِ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ ۚ وَمَا يَجْحَدُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ إِلَّا ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
rows.translation: But it is clear revelations in the hearts of those who have been given knowledge, and none deny Our revelations save wrong-doers.
rows.transliteration: bal huwa āyātun bayyinātun fī ṣudūril ladhīna ūtul `il-m ۚ wa mā yajḥadu bi-āyātinā illaẓ ẓālimūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ ۖ قُلْ إِنَّمَا ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: And they say: Why are not portents sent down upon him from his Lord? Say: Portents are with Allah only, and I am but a plain warner.
rows.transliteration: waqālū lawlā unzila `alayhi āyātun min rabbih ۖ qul innamal-āyātu `indallāhi wa innamā ana nadhīrun mubīn

rows.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَكْفِهِمْ أَنَّآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَرَحْمَةً وَذِكْرَىٰ لِقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: Is it not enough for them that We have sent down unto thee the Scripture which is read unto them? Lo! herein verily is mercy, and a reminder for folk who believe.
rows.transliteration: awalam yakfihim annā anzalnā `alaykal kitāba yutlā `alayhim ۚ inna fī dhālika laraḥmatan wadhikrā liqawmiy yu-minūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ كَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَكُمْ شَهِيدًا ۖ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ وَكَفَرُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرُونَ
rows.translation: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Allah sufficeth for witness between me and you. He knoweth whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those who believe in vanity and disbelieve in Allah, they it is who are the losers.
rows.transliteration: qul kafā billāhi baynī wabaynakum shahīdā ۖ ya`lamu mā fis samāwāti wal-arḍ ۗ wal ladhīna āmanū bil bāṭili wakafarū billāhi ulā-ika humul khāsirūn

rows.arabic: وَيَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ بِٱلْعَذَابِ ۚ وَلَوْلَآ أَجَلٌ مُّسَمًّى لَّجَآءَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ وَلَيَأْتِيَنَّهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: They bid thee hasten on the doom (of Allah). And if a term had not been appointed, the doom would assuredly have come unto them (ere now). And verily it will come upon them suddenly when they perceive not.
rows.transliteration: wayasta`jilūnaka bil `adhāb ۚ walawlā ajalun musamman lajā-ahumul `adhābu walaya-tiyannahum baghtatan wahum lā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: يَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ بِٱلْعَذَابِ وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمُحِيطَةٌۢ بِٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: They bid thee hasten on the doom, when lo! hell verily will encompass the disbelievers
rows.transliteration: yasta`jilūnaka bil `adhābi wa inna jahannama lamuḥīṭatun bil kāfirīn

rows.arabic: يَوْمَ يَغْشَىٰهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ مِن فَوْقِهِمْ وَمِن تَحْتِ أَرْجُلِهِمْ وَيَقُولُ ذُوقُوا۟ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: On the day when the doom will overwhelm them from above them and from underneath their feet, and He will say: Taste what ye used to do!
rows.transliteration: yawma yaghshāhumul `adhābu min fawqihim wa min taḥti arjulihim wayaqūlu dhūqū mā kuntum ta`malūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰعِبَادِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِنَّ أَرْضِى وَٰسِعَةٌ فَإِيَّـٰىَ فَٱعْبُدُونِ
rows.translation: O my bondmen who believe! Lo! My earth is spacious. Therefor serve Me only.
rows.transliteration: yā`ibādiyal ladhīna āmanū inna arḍī wāsi`atun fa-iyyāya fa`budūn

rows.arabic: كُلُّ نَفْسٍ ذَآئِقَةُ ٱلْمَوْتِ ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَيْنَا تُرْجَعُونَ
rows.translation: Every soul will taste of death. Then unto Us ye will be returned.
rows.transliteration: kullu nafsin dhā-iqatul mawt ۖ thumma ilaynā turja`ūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَنُبَوِّئَنَّهُم مِّنَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ غُرَفًا تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ نِعْمَ أَجْرُ ٱلْعَـٰمِلِينَ
rows.translation: Those who believe and do good works, them verily We shall house in lofty dwellings of the Garden underneath which rivers flow. There they will dwell secure. How sweet the guerdon of the toilers,
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti lanubawwi-annahum minal jannati ghurafan tajrī min taḥtihal-anhāru khālidīna fīhā ۚ ni`ma ajrul `āmilīn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا۟ وَعَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَتَوَكَّلُونَ
rows.translation: Who persevere, and put their trust in their Lord!
rows.transliteration: alladhīna ṣabarū wa`alā rabbihim yatawakkalūn

rows.arabic: وَكَأَيِّن مِّن دَآبَّةٍ لَّا تَحْمِلُ رِزْقَهَا ٱللَّهُ يَرْزُقُهَا وَإِيَّاكُمْ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
rows.translation: And how many an animal there is that beareth not its own provision! Allah provideth for it and for you. He is the Hearer, the Knower.
rows.transliteration: waka-ayyin min dābbatin lā taḥmilu rizqahallāhu yarzuquhā wa iyyākum ۚ wahuwas samī`ul `alīm

rows.arabic: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَسَخَّرَ ٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ لَيَقُولُنَّ ٱللَّهُ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ يُؤْفَكُونَ
rows.translation: And if thou wert to ask them: Who created the heavens and the earth, and constrained the sun and the moon (to their appointed work)? they would say: Allah. How then are they turned away?
rows.transliteration: wala-in sa-altahum man khalaqas samāwāti wal-arḍa wasakhharash shamsa wal qamara layaqūlunnallāh ۖ fa-annā yu-fakūn

rows.arabic: ٱللَّهُ يَبْسُطُ ٱلرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ وَيَقْدِرُ لَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: Allah maketh the provision wide for whom He will of His bondmen, and straiteneth it for whom (He will). Lo! Allah is Aware of all things.
rows.transliteration: allāhu yabsuṭur rizqa liman yashā-u min `ibādihi wayaqdiru lah ۚ innallāha bikulli shay-in `alīm

rows.arabic: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّن نَّزَّلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً فَأَحْيَا بِهِ ٱلْأَرْضَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَوْتِهَا لَيَقُولُنَّ ٱللَّهُ ۚ قُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: And if thou wert to ask them: Who causeth water to come down from the sky, and therewith reviveth the earth after its death? they verily would say: Allah. Say: Praise be to Allah! But most of them have no sense.
rows.transliteration: wala-in sa-altahum man nazzala minas samā-i mā-an fa-aḥyā bihil-arḍa min ba`di mawtihā layaqūlunnallāh ۚ qulil ḥamdu lillāh ۚ bal aktharuhum lā ya`qilūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَآ إِلَّا لَهْوٌ وَلَعِبٌ ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱلدَّارَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ لَهِىَ ٱلْحَيَوَانُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: This life of the world is but a pastime and a game. Lo! the home of the Hereafter - that is Life, if they but knew.
rows.transliteration: wa mā hādhihil ḥayātud dunyā illā lahwun wala`ib ۚ wa innad dāral-ākhirata lahiyal ḥayawān ۚ law kānū ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: فَإِذَا رَكِبُوا۟ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ دَعَوُا۟ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ فَلَمَّا نَجَّىٰهُمْ إِلَى ٱلْبَرِّ إِذَا هُمْ يُشْرِكُونَ
rows.translation: And when they mount upon the ships they pray to Allah, making their faith pure for Him only, but when He bringeth them safe to land, behold! they ascribe partners (unto Him),
rows.transliteration: fa-idhā rakibū fil fulki da`awullāha mukhliṣīna lahud dīna falammā najjāhum ilal-barri idhā hum yushrikūn

rows.arabic: لِيَكْفُرُوا۟ بِمَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمْ وَلِيَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: That they may disbelieve in that which We have given them, and that they may take their ease. But they will come to know.
rows.transliteration: liyakfurū bimā ātaynāhum waliyatamatta`ū ۖ fasawfa ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّا جَعَلْنَا حَرَمًا ءَامِنًا وَيُتَخَطَّفُ ٱلنَّاسُ مِنْ حَوْلِهِمْ ۚ أَفَبِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ يُؤْمِنُونَ وَبِنِعْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ يَكْفُرُونَ
rows.translation: Have they not seen that We have appointed a sanctuary immune (from violence), while mankind are ravaged all around them? Do they then believe in falsehood and disbelieve in the bounty of Allah?
rows.transliteration: awalam yaraw annā ja`alnā ḥaraman āminan wayutakhaṭṭafun nāsu min ḥawlihim ۚ afabil bāṭili yu-minūna wabini`matil lāhi yakfurūn

rows.arabic: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَوْ كَذَّبَ بِٱلْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَآءَهُۥٓ ۚ أَلَيْسَ فِى جَهَنَّمَ مَثْوًى لِّلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: Who doeth greater wrong than he who inventeth a lie concerning Allah, or denieth the truth when it cometh unto him? Is not there a home in hell for disbelievers?
rows.transliteration: wa man aẓlamu mimmanif-tarā `alallāhi kadhiban aw kadhhaba bil ḥaqqi lammā jā-ah ۚ alaysa fī jahannama mathwan lilkāfirīn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ جَـٰهَدُوا۟ فِينَا لَنَهْدِيَنَّهُمْ سُبُلَنَا ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَمَعَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: As for those who strive in Us, We surely guide them to Our paths, and lo! Allah is with the good.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna jāhadū fīnā lanahdiyannahum subulanā ۚ wa innallāha lama`al muḥsinīn
